definition: to ease (tension)/to relax/to cause sth to relax/to alleviate/relaxed/easy and unhurried/leisurely/soothing/mild (slope)
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate

sentences.english: You need be for balance and contrast, for prayer and inner peace
sentences.chinese: 你需我來趨於衡平，尋求對照，潛心祝禱，舒緩內心。

sentences.english: Over there, a man performed the slow-motion dance of tai chi.
sentences.chinese: 那邊，一個男人在練習動作舒緩的太極。

sentences.english: Before going into the room, take three DEEP breaths!
sentences.chinese: 進考場前的深呼吸可以幫你舒緩壓力及緊張情緒。

sentences.english: A soothing delicate unscented amber for use on sensitive, dry or irritated complexions . Men love its calming effects after shaving.
sentences.chinese: 用於敏感的皮膚，調節膚色，帶來愜意的舒緩感覺。

sentences.english: The upward and downward motion of your tongue should be done repeatedly and unhurriedly.
sentences.chinese: 溫柔舒緩的反覆上下活動你的舌頭。

sentences.english: It eases dry skin and helps to heal cracked and chapped skin quickly.
sentences.chinese: 它能很快的舒緩乾燥的皮膚，輔助治療龜裂的皮膚。

sentences.english: Rub or touch lightly onto skin to soothe and promote healing.
sentences.chinese: 揉擦輕觸在皮膚表面，來舒緩和促進皮膚的治癒。

sentences.english: The spring water comes out gently and euphoniously.
sentences.chinese: 泉水叮咚，彈一曲心中舒緩的歌。

sentences.english: Market fears of bank insolvency, particularly, have been assuaged.
sentences.chinese: 市場對銀行資不抵債的擔憂，尤其得到了舒緩。

sentences.english: Gargling with warm saltwater helps relieve a soar throat, according to WebMD.
sentences.chinese: 用溫鹽水漱口有助於舒緩喉嚨癢痛，據中央社報道。

sentences.english: Tones and soothes normal and problem skin.
sentences.chinese: 滋潤和舒緩正常及問題皮膚。

sentences.english: Peppermint is frequently used to allay nausea and vomiting and will relieve the pain of colic.
sentences.chinese: 歐薄荷常被用作緩和反胃和嘔吐，亦舒緩絞痛。

sentences.english: In aromatherapy, natural rose oil helps soothing and stabilizing your skin.
sentences.chinese: 在芳香療法中，天然玫瑰油有助於舒緩和鎮靜肌膚。

sentences.english: When David was invited to King Saul's court, he soothed the king's nerves by playing on his lyre.
sentences.chinese: 大衛應邀進入掃羅王的宮廷，彈琴舒緩王的情緒。

sentences.english: Either way hearing your voice can be soothing to the little peanut.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎樣，能聽到你的聲音都會讓小不點心情舒緩。

sentences.english: Some people like listening to soothing music.
sentences.chinese: 有人喜歡聽一些舒緩的音樂。

definition: to bring relief/to alleviate (a crisis)/to dull (a pain)
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
to ease (tension)/to alleviate/to moderate/to allay/to make more mild
to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
to adjust/to regulate/to harmonize/to reconcile (accountancy etc)
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
